semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Patients Admitted with Healed Non-Pressure Ulcers
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 12. Chapter 12: Diseases of the Skin and Subcutaneous Tissue > b. Non-Pressure Chronic Ulcers > 1. Patients admitted with non-pressure ulcers documented as healed

content.full_text: No code is assigned if the documentation states that the non-pressure ulcer is completely healed at the time of admission. (Evidence: pg no: 60, L9-L10)
content.summary: No coding is required for non-pressure ulcers that are completely healed at admission (Evidence: pg no: 60, L9-L10)
key_concepts: Completely healed ulcers (Evidence: pg no: 60, L9)
Time of admission (Evidence: pg no: 60, L10)

detailed_rules.rule_text: No code is assigned if the documentation states that the non-pressure ulcer is completely healed at the time of admission (Evidence: pg no: 60, L9-L10)
detailed_rules.explanation: When documentation clearly indicates a non-pressure ulcer is completely healed upon admission, no ulcer code should be assigned (Evidence: pg no: 60, L9-L10)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Review documentation for non-pressure ulcer status
Step 2: Determine if ulcer is documented as completely healed at admission
Step 3: If completely healed, do not assign any ulcer code

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient admitted with documentation stating 'venous ulcer completely healed'
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient has history of venous ulcer on left leg, completely healed at time of admission
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify non-pressure ulcer in documentation
Step 2: Note that ulcer is documented as completely healed
Step 3: Do not assign any ulcer code

correct_coding.rationale: Documentation states ulcer is completely healed at admission, so no code is assigned (Evidence: pg no: 60, L9-L10)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Guidelines specify no code should be assigned for completely healed ulcers
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Assigning ulcer codes for healed conditions

warnings: Do not assign codes for ulcers documented as completely healed at admission (Evidence: pg no: 60, L9-L10)
best_practices: Carefully review documentation to determine healing status at admission (Evidence: pg no: 60, L9-L10)
common_mistakes: Assigning ulcer codes for conditions documented as completely healed (Evidence: pg no: 60, L9-L10)
tips: Look for specific language indicating 'completely healed' status (Evidence: pg no: 60, L9)
implementation_notes: This applies specifically to the time of admission assessment
clinical_context: Healed ulcers represent resolved conditions that do not require active coding
